author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Northeast US to witness another heat wave this weekTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Northeast US to witness another heat wave this week
The year may have reached September but summer is yet to go anywhere just yet across the Northeast.
A gust of July-like heat and humidity will make its way into the Northeast this week, sending some thermometers back into the 90s Fahrenheit alongside uncomfortable humidity levels for several days.
Much of the Interstate 95 corridor, including Washington, D.C., New York City and Philadelphia, will have several consecutive days with temperatures in the 90s, marking an official heat wave for the area.
A large area of high pressure nearby will keep the heat in place for a while. This will also send storms farther north into Canada and should keep most tropical moisture at bay in the South.
The heat will not only be confined to the Northeast. Above-average temperatures will stretch across the Midwest and Great Lakes region as well. Chicago, Detroit and Indianapolis will have high temperatures this week 5 to 15 degrees above normal.
The combination of the heat and high humidity will make for rather uncomfortable conditions outside this week. Those who must endure several hours working in these conditions are advised to stay hydrated and to take breaks in the shade or in an air-conditioned environment.
Heat is one of the leading weather-related killers in the United States every year and is something to be taken seriously. Several precautionary measures can be taken to beat the heat.
